contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox airline |airline =Tofino Air |logo =Tofino Air terminal.JPG |logo_size = |fleet_size =8,<ref name="fleet"/> 13<ref name="TCFleet"/> |destinations=5<ref name="sked"/> |IATA = |ICAO = |callsign = |founded =1990s (as Midcoast Air) |headquarters =Vancouver Harbour, Unit #1 Burrard Landing, 1055 Canada Place, Vancouver, BC, V6C 0C3<ref name="head">[http://www.tofinoair.ca/contact.asp Contact Us]</ref> |key_people = |hubs =[[Vancouver Harbour Water Airport]],<br>[[Nanaimo Harbour Water Airport]],<br> [[Sechelt/Porpoise Bay Water Aerodrome|Sechelt Water Aerodrome]] |focus_cities = |frequent_flyer= |lounge = |alliance = |website =[http://www.tofinoair.ca/ www.tofinoair.ca] }}[[File:Tofino Air Cessna 180.JPG|thumb|Tofino Air [[Cessna 180]] at [[Tofino Harbour Water Aerodrome]]]] '''Tofino Air''' is a small [[Canada|Canadian]] airline offering [[floatplane]] service from five [[British Columbia]] locations: [[Vancouver]], [[Nanaimo]], [[Sechelt, British Columbia|Sechelt]] [[Gabriola Island]] and [[Tofino]].<ref name="sked">[http://www.tofinoair.ca/schedules.asp Tofino Air Bases]</ref> Tofino Air offers scheduled services, scenic tours, and specialized charters.<ref>[http://www.tofinoair.ca/scenics_charters.asp Tofino Air Tours]</ref> ==History== In the early 1990s, the owner of Tofino Air, and a lifelong resident of [[Sunshine Coast (British Columbia)|British Columbia's Sunshine Coast]], started a small regional airline called "Midcoast Air," to better assure safety and dependability for himself and his co-workers as they travelled from the logging and fishing camps on BC's west coast, to their homes on the Sunshine Coast. In 1998, Midcoast Air re-located to [[Sechelt]]. In January 2001, Tofino Air purchased Pacific Spirit Air based in Silva Bay on Gabriola Island. After purchasing Pacific Spirit Air, Tofino Air increased its daily routes by adding in scheduled flights from Gabriola Island to Vancouver International Airport. The airline also continued offering daily scheduled flights between [[Departure Bay, British Columbia|Departure Bay]] in Nanaimo and [[Sechelt/Porpoise Bay Water Aerodrome|Sechelt]]. In April 2011, Tofino Air moved from its location in Departure Bay to the Harbour of Nanaimo where it began to offer scheduled flights between Nanaimo and [[Vancouver]]. In late May 2011, Tofino Air was one of the first airlines to move into the new [[Vancouver Harbour Water Airport]], and began to offer scheduled flights to Nanaimo, Sechelt and Tofino. ==Destinations== *British Columbia<ref name="sked"/> **[[Gabriola Island]] (Silva Bay) **[[Nanaimo]] ([[Nanaimo Harbour Water Airport]]) **[[Sechelt, British Columbia|Sechelt]] ([[Sechelt/Porpoise Bay Water Aerodrome]]) **[[Tofino]] ([[Tofino Harbour Water Aerodrome]]) **[[Vancouver]] ([[Vancouver Harbour Water Airport]]) ==Fleet== The Tofino Air fleet consists of the following aircraft (as of December 2012):<ref name="fleet">[http://www.tofinoair.ca/aircraft.asp Tofino Air fleet details]</ref><ref name="TCFleet">[http://wwwapps2.tc.gc.ca/Saf-Sec-Sur/2/ccarcs/aspscripts/en/quicksearch.asp Transport Canada listing of aircraft owned by "Tofino Air"] (enter Tofino Air in the box titled "Owner Name")</ref> {| class="toccolours" border="1" cellpadding="2" style="border-collapse:collapse" |+ '''First Air Fleet''' |- bgcolor=lightgreen !Aircraft||No. of Aircraft<br>(Tofino Air list)<ref name="fleet"/>||No. of Aircraft<br>([[Transport Canada|TC]] list)<ref name="TCFleet" />||Variants||Notes |- |[[Cessna 180|Cessna 180 Skywagon]]||3||4||[[Cessna 180#180J|180J]]||6 seats |- |[[de Havilland Canada DHC-2 Beaver]]||4||8||DHC2, DHC2 MK. 1||6 seats |- |[[de Havilland Canada DHC-3 Otter]]||1||1||[[de Havilland Canada DHC-3 Otter#DHC-3-T Turbo-Otter|DHC-3-T Turbo-Otter]]||9-10 seats |} ==References== {{reflist|30em}} ==External links== {{commons category|Tofino Air}} *[http://www.tofinoair.ca/ Tofino Air], official site {{Airlines of Canada}} [[Category:Regional airlines of British Columbia]] [[Category:Seaplane operators]]
